tasks.title: Initialize Next.js Project
tasks.description: Initialize the Next.js 15 project with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and pnpm. Configure the basic project structure and install necessary dependencies.
tasks.details:
1. Use `pnpm create next-app` to scaffold a new Next.js project.
2. Select TypeScript, ESLint, Tailwind CSS, `src/` directory, App Router, and import alias options.
3. Configure `tsconfig.json` for strict mode.
4. Install `lucide-react`, `headlessui`, and `framer-motion`.
5. Set up basic directory structure: `components`, `lib`, `pages`, `styles`.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify that the project builds successfully and that the basic project structure is in place. Run `pnpm run dev` and ensure the default Next.js page loads correctly.

tasks.title: Implement Core Design System and UI Components
tasks.description: Implement the core design system based on the Vercel style, including color palettes, typography, and spacing. Create a set of reusable UI components using Headless UI and Tailwind CSS.
tasks.details:
1. Define color palette (grayscale + accent color) in `tailwind.config.js`.
2. Create base typography styles using Tailwind CSS.
3. Implement common UI components (buttons, inputs, cards, etc.) using Headless UI for accessibility and Tailwind CSS for styling.
4. Use Framer Motion for animations and transitions.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify that the design system is consistent and that the UI components are reusable and accessible. Test components in different browsers and screen sizes.

subtasks.title: Define Color Palette in Tailwind Configuration
subtasks.description: Establish a primary and secondary color palette within the `tailwind.config.js` file. Include shades for various UI states (hover, active, disabled).
subtasks.details:
Research color accessibility guidelines. Document the color palette choices and their intended uses.

<info added on 2025-07-02T05:06:05.487Z>
**Implementation Plan: Verify and Expose User Sessions**

The core of this task is to verify the correctness of the authentication callbacks and establish a mechanism for our front-end application (whether server-side or client-side components) to easily obtain the session information of the currently logged-in user.

**1. Verify the `session` Callback:**
   - Check `src/app/api/auth/[...nextauth]/route.ts` for `callbacks.session`.
   - Ensure `user.id` is correctly attached to `session.user.id`.

**2. Create a Server-Side Session Retrieval Helper Function:**
   - Create a new file, e.g., `src/lib/auth.ts`.
